importantArticles.headline: Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) has been one of the best investments of all time.  With a market cap of nearly $800 billion, Tesla's biggest days of growth are arguably behind it.  This reality has caused investors to search for the next Tesla capable of producing huge gains.
importantArticles.title: 2 High-Growth Electric Vehicle (EV) Stocks to Buy Now (Hint: Not Tesla)

importantArticles.headline: Jeff Bezos is reportedly backing a Michigan-based all-electric mobility startup, Slate Auto, with a goal of developing a cheap single-cab EV truck to take on the likes of Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) and Rivian Automotive Inc. (NASDAQ:RIVN). What happened: A report published by TechCrunch shared that the company is backed by Amazon.com Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN) founder Jeff Bezos. The report said that Slate Auto has brought in people from the likes of Ford Motor Co. (NYSE:F), Harley-Davidson Inc. (NYSE:HOG
importantArticles.title: Jeff Bezos-Backed Slate Auto To Take On Elon Musk's Tesla, Rivian With Budget EV Pickup: Report

importantArticles.headline: China’s suspension of critical rare earth minerals exports to the US could become a major headache for US companies, particularly automakers like Tesla, GM, and Rivian.
importantArticles.title: Why Tesla, GM, and Rivian will be hurt most by China's critical minerals export ban

importantArticles.headline: Investing.com -- Bernstein has reiterated its bearish stance on Rivian (NASDAQ:RIVN), warning that the electric vehicle (EV) maker’s shares could face nearly 50% downside from current levels due to mounting tariff pressures and financial headwinds.
importantArticles.title: Rivian stock could fall by nearly 50%, Bernstein warns

importantArticles.headline: China’s suspension of critical rare earth minerals exports to the US could become a major headache for US companies, particularly automakers like Tesla, GM, and Rivian.

importantArticles.headline: A number of stocks jumped in the afternoon session after markets rallied sharply on news that President Trump announced a 90-day tariff pause. Reciprocal tariffs were also dropped to 10% for most countries, sparking renewed optimism amid ongoing trade talks. The major stock indices rose as investors, growing impatient of seemingly irrational tariff actions, welcomed the pause as a sign of a more measured path forward.
importantArticles.title: Lucid (LCID) and American Airlines (AAL), Delta Air Lines (DAL), Ford (F), Rivian (RIVN) Shares Are Soaring, What You Need To Know
